Source: Risa A, Divinyi DM, Baka E, Krifaton C. Aflatoxin B1 detoxification by cell-free extracts of Rhodococcus strains. Acta Microbiol Immunol Hung. 2017 Dec 1;64(4):423-438. doi: 10.1556/030.64.2017.023. Epub 2017 Dec 1. PMID: 29192510.
Additional information: Two Rhodococcus species used R. erythropolis NI1 and R. rhodochrous NI2. 84% degredation potential seen in both strains. Extracellular tested as well, but did not show reduced genotoxicity

Source: Poppenberger B, Berthiller F, Lucyshyn D, Sieberer T, Schuhmacher R, Krska R, Kuchler K, Glössl J, Luschnig C, Adam G. Detoxification of the Fusarium mycotoxin deoxynivalenol by a UDP-glucosyltransferase from Arabidopsis thaliana. J Biol Chem. 2003 Nov 28;278(48):47905-14. doi: 10.1074/jbc.M307552200. Epub 2003 Sep 11. PMID: 12970342.
Additional information: NA

Source: Shu X, Wang Y, Zhou Q, et al. Biological Degradation of Aflatoxin B₁ by Cell-Free Extracts of Bacillus velezensis DY3108 with Broad PH Stability and Excellent Thermostability. Toxins (Basel). 2018;10(8):330. Published 2018 Aug 14. doi:10.3390/toxins10080330
Additional information: NA

Characterization context: Cell-free extracts, genes cloned/expressed in E.coli
Source: Abdulla D. Altalhi, Bahig El-Deeb, Localization of zearalenone detoxification gene(s) in pZEA-1 plasmid of Pseudomonas putida ZEA-1 and expressed in Escherichia coli, Journal of Hazardous Materials, Volume 161, Issues 2–3, 2009, Pages 1166-1172, ISSN 0304-3894, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jhazmat.2008.04.068.
Additional information: Relevant genes in P putida replicated in E coli plasmid

Source: Hassan, Y.I., He, J.W., Perilla, N. et al. The enzymatic epimerization of deoxynivalenol by Devosia mutans proceeds through the formation of 3-keto-DON intermediate. Sci Rep 7, 6929 (2017). https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-017-07319-0
Additional information: The enzymes that perform biotranformation and their respective mechanisms are not identified, yet it is known that they utilize NADPH and the chemical alterations that they make are known

Source: Shao, S., Cai, J., Du, X. et al. Biotransformation and detoxification of aflatoxin B1 by extracellular extract of Cladosporium uredinicola . Food Sci Biotechnol 25, 1789–1794 (2016). https://doi.org/10.1007/s10068-016-0272-7
Additional information: After incubating the strain, Aflatoxin was still eliminated and the enzyme was shown to be thermostable/heat-resistant

Source: Péter Harkai, István Szabó, Mátyás Cserháti, Csilla Krifaton, Anita Risa, Júlia Radó, Adrienn Balázs, Kinga Berta, Balázs Kriszt, Biodegradation of aflatoxin-B1 and zearalenone by Streptomyces sp. collection, International Biodeterioration & Biodegradation, Volume 108, 2016, Pages 48-56, ISSN 0964-8305, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ibiod.2015.12.007.
Additional information: Streptomyces cacaoi subsp. asoensis strain degraded AFB1 over 88% and Streptomyces rimosus almost completely degraded zearalenone. Due to antibiotics production, Streptomyces strains cannot be used in biodegradation methods as a member of inocula but do produce degrading enzymes that could be a promising solution.

Source: Zhao, Z., Zhang, Y., Gong, A. et al. Biodegradation of mycotoxin fumonisin B1 by a novel bacterial consortium SAAS79. Appl Microbiol Biotechnol 103, 7129–7140 (2019). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00253-019-09979-6
Additional information: The bacterial consortium came from mushrooms. Pseudomonas was found to be highly responsibile for the mycotoxin degradation. Mechanism is not entirely clear but doth enzyme degradation and adsorption are possible mechanism

Source: Luís Abrunhosa, António Inês, Ana I. Rodrigues, Ana Guimarães, Vânia L. Pereira, Pier Parpot, Arlete Mendes-Faia, Armando Venâncio, Biodegradation of ochratoxin A by Pediococcus parvulus isolated from Douro wines, International Journal of Food Microbiology, Volume 188, 2014, Pages 45-52, ISSN 0168-1605, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ijfoodmicro.2014.07.019.
Additional information: They investigate adsorption methods as well, but they were less successful. Strains mediate OTA biodegradation under anaerobic conditions, may be suitable as silage inoculants or as feed additives

Source: Oswald, Isabelle P., et al. ""Mycotoxin fumonisin B1 increases intestinal colonization by pathogenic Escherichia coli in pigs."" Applied and Environmental Microbiology 69.10 (2003): 5870-5874.
Additional information: FB1 inhibits ceramide synthase activity, which leads to disruption of sphingolipid metabolism

Source: Utermark, Jan, and Petr Karlovsky. ""Role of zearalenone lactonase in protection of Gliocladium roseum from fungitoxic effects of the mycotoxin zearalenone."" Applied and environmental microbiology 73.2 (2007): 637-642.
Additional information: The growth of G. roseum was not inhibited by zearalenone, and the lactonase may protect G. roseum from the toxic effects of this mycotoxin

Source: Motomura, M., Toyomasu, T., Mizuno, K., & Shinozawa, T. (2003). Purification and characterization of an aflatoxin degradation enzyme fromPleurotus ostreatus. Microbiological Research, 158(3), 237-242. doi:https://doi.org/10.1078/0944-5013-00199
Additional information: Fluorescence measurements suggest that the enzyme cleaves the lactone ring of AFB1 which normally causes carcinogenic effects

Source: Wang X, Qin X, Hao Z, Luo H, Yao B, Su X. Degradation of Four Major Mycotoxins by Eight Manganese Peroxidases in Presence of a Dicarboxylic Acid. Toxins (Basel). 2019 Sep 27;11(10):566. doi: 10.3390/toxins11100566. PMID: 31569657; PMCID: PMC6833064.
Additional information: Dicarboxylic acid malonate must be present in order for this enzyme to function. Enyzme was most effective in degrading AFB1. These enzymes were recombinantly produced in E.coli

Characterization assay: PCR, Inverse PCR, an FB1 degradation assay, and a HFB1 deamination assay
Source: Heinl S, Hartinger D, Thamhesl M, Vekiru E, Krska R, Schatzmayr G, Moll WD, Grabherr R. Degradation of fumonisin B1 by the consecutive action of two bacterial enzymes. J Biotechnol. 2010 Jan 15;145(2):120-9. doi: 10.1016/j.jbiotec.2009.11.004. Epub 2009 Nov 14. PMID: 19922747.
Additional information: This study used 2 genes, fumI and fumD, which encode a carboxylesterase and deaminase, which was cloned into a yeast strain and expressed in the yeast. The article describes deamination as occurring within the sphingopyxis strain but the location of the deesterification step was not described

Source: Na Ge, Jingjing Xu, Bangzhu Peng, Siyi Pan, Adsorption mechanism of tenuazonic acid using inactivated lactic acid bacteria, Food Control, Volume 82, 2017, Pages 274-282, ISSN 0956-7135, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foodcont.2017.07.009.
Additional information: modified inactivated lactic acid bacteria used

Source: Arunrussamee Sangsila, Virginie Faucet-Marquis, Annie Pfohl-Leszkowicz, Pariyaporn Itsaranuwat, Detoxification of zearalenone by Lactobacillus pentosus strains, Food Control, Volume 62, 2016, Pages 187-192, ISSN 0956-7135, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foodcont.2015.10.031.
Additional information: Eight Lactobacillus pentosus strains were used in this experiment

Source: Antje Brodehl, Anne Möller, Hans-Jörg Kunte, Matthias Koch, Ronald Maul, Biotransformation of the mycotoxin zearalenone by fungi of the genera Rhizopus and Aspergillus, FEMS Microbiology Letters, Volume 359, Issue 1, October 2014, Pages 124–130
Additional information: Two Aspergillus oryzae strains and all seven Rhizopus species were able to convert ZEN into various metabolite

Source: Wang, Y.; Zhang, H.; Yan, H.; Yin, C.; Liu, Y.; Xu, Q.; Liu, X.; Zhang, Z. Effective Biodegradation of Aflatoxin B1 Using the Bacillus licheniformis (BL010) Strain. Toxins 2018, 10, 497. https://doi.org/10.3390/toxins10120497
Additional information: Strain used was Bacillus licheniformis (BL010). Crude enzyme solution had most degredation. Non induced BL010 did not have degredation capability

Source: Danial, EN, Lamfon, MY, Alghamdi, LA, Alamri, AM, Alghamdi, MS, Alghamdi, SA. Remove of aflatoxin G1 using lactic acid bacteria. J Food Process Preserv. 2021; 45:e15090.
Additional information: Experiment compared ten lactic acid bacteria. Mechinism of degradation focused on cell binding.

Source: Smiley RD, Draughon FA. Preliminary evidence that degradation of aflatoxin B1 by Flavobacterium aurantiacum is enzymatic. J Food Prot. 2000 Mar;63(3):415-8. doi: 10.4315/0362-028x-63.3.415. PMID: 10716576.
Additional information: NA

Source: Luís Abrunhosa, Rita Serra, and Armando Venâncio

Additional information: removed up to 95% within 48 hours. Although degredation by enzymes is the main mechanism for mycotoxin removal, the cell wall also absorbs the patulin

Source: Scarpari M, Bello C, Pietricola C, Zaccaria M, Bertocchi L, Angelucci A, Ricciardi MR, Scala V, Parroni A, Fabbri AA, Reverberi M, Zjalic S, Fanelli C. Aflatoxin control in maize by Trametes versicolor. Toxins (Basel). 2014 Dec 17;6(12):3426-37.

Additional information: Paradevosia shaoguanensis DDB001 was the specific strain studied, the strain transformed deoxynivalenon into the less toxic form: 3‐epi‐deoxynivalenol (3‐epi‐DON). Can remove 200 mg/L of DON in complete growth medium. Unknown if process is enzymatic and future study is necessary to determine

Source: Zoghi A, Khosravi-Darani K, Sohrabvandi S, Attar H. Patulin removal from synbiotic apple juice using Lactobacillus plantarum ATCC 8014. J Appl Microbiol. 2019 Apr;126(4):1149-1160. doi: 10.1111/jam.14172. Epub 2019 Feb 18. PMID: 30520191.
Additional information: NA

Additional information: Did not specify anaerobic but comes from lactic acid bacteria

Source: Xiulan Sun et al. Biological detoxification of zearalenone by Aspergillus niger strain FS10
Additional information: Strain reduces ZEN contamination via mechanisms involving binding and metabolism of toxin

Source: Jin H, Hiraoka Y, Okuma Y, Hashimoto EH, Kurita M, Anas ARJ, Uemura H, Tsuji K, Harada KI. Microbial Degradation of Amino Acid-Containing Compounds Using the Microcystin-Degrading Bacterial Strain B-9. Mar Drugs. 2018 Feb 6;16(2):50.
Additional information: Strain of bacteria used was B-9- 99% similarity to S. microcystinivorans; can only degrade amino acid containing molecules

Source: Fuchs, S. et al. Detoxification of patulin and ochratoxin A, two abundant mycotoxins, by lactic acid bacteria
Additional information: likely the extracellular enzyme lactase in play

Source: Ricelli A, Baruzzi F, Solfrizzo M, Morea M, Fanizzi FP. Biotransformation of patulin by Gluconobacter oxydans. Appl Environ Microbiol. 2007 Feb;73(3):785-92. doi: 10.1128/AEM.02032-06. Epub 2006 Nov 17. PMID: 17114325; PMCID: PMC1800745.
Additional information: G. oxydans degrades up to 96% of patulin to ascladiol, strain M3 able to degrade the most (400-800 μg/ml))

Source: Zhang, X., Yang, H., Apaliya, M., Zhao, L., Gu, X., Zheng, X., Hu, W. and Zhang, H. (2018), The mechanisms involved in ochratoxin A elimination by Yarrowia lipolytica Y‐2. Ann Appl Biol, 173: 164-174.
Additional information: OTA was degraded to OTα by the hydrolysis activity of carboxypepetidases. studies show that it is not absorption by the cell wall. Many proteins are also invovled in the degradation process.

Source: Nathanail AV, Gibson B, Han L, Peltonen K, Ollilainen V, Jestoi M, Laitila A. The lager yeast Saccharomyces pastorianus removes and transforms Fusarium trichothecene mycotoxins during fermentation of brewer's wort. Food Chem. 2016 Jul 15;203:448-455. doi: 10.1016/j.foodchem.2016.02.070. Epub 2016 Feb 10. PMID: 26948637.
Additional information: analyses of metabolites by LC–QTOF–MS/MS showed mycotoxin conjugates and acetylation was found as the main biotransformation pathway

Source: Ben Teheur, Fadia et al. Aflatoxin B 1 degradation by microorganisms isolated from Kombucha culture
Additional information: P. occidentalis KOP7 is most effective, toxicity eval. (MTT) on Hep2 cell and brine shrimp

Source: Hui Tang, Xiaohong Li, Fang Zhang, Xianghong Meng, Bingjie Liu, Biodegradation of the mycotoxin patulin in apple juice by Orotate phosphoribosyltransferase from Rhodotorula mucilaginosa, Food Control, Volume 100, 2019, Pages 158-164, ISSN 0956-7135, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.foodcont.2019.01.020.
Additional information: The enzyme was serated from the bacteria and used seperately.  the increase of amino acid concentration may owe to the degradation of Orotate phosphoribosyltransferase.

Source: Hideaki KAKEYA, Naoko TAKAHASHI-ANDO, Makoto KIMURA, Rie ONOSE, Isamu YAMAGUCHI, Hiroyuki OSADA, Biotransformation of the Mycotoxin, Zearalenone, to a Non-estrogenic Compound by a Fungal Strain of Clonostachys sp., Bioscience, Biotechnology, and Biochemistry, Volume 66, Issue 12, 1 January 2002, Pages 2723–2726
Additional information: When fed to animals, zearalenone causes serious problems such as vulvovaginitis, constant estrus, pseudopregnancy, infertility, teratogenisity, and mutagenisity

Source: Taylor MC, Jackson CJ, Tattersall DB, French N, Peat TS, Newman J, Briggs LJ, Lapalikar GV, Campbell PM, Scott C, Russell RJ, Oakeshott JG. Identification and characterization of two families of F420 H2-dependent reductases from Mycobacteria that catalyse aflatoxin degradation. Mol Microbiol. 2010 Nov;78(3):561-75. doi: 10.1111/j.1365-2958.2010.07356.x. Epub 2010 Sep 16. PMID: 20807200; PMCID: PMC3034190.
Additional information: NA

Source: Kumara SS, Bashisht A, Venkateswaran G, Hariprasad P, Gayathri D. Characterization of Novel Lactobacillus fermentum from Curd Samples of Indigenous Cows from Malnad Region, Karnataka, for their Aflatoxin B1 Binding and Probiotic Properties. Probiotics Antimicrob Proteins. 2019 Dec;11(4):1100-1109. doi: 10.1007/s12602-018-9479-7. PMID: 30368716.
Additional information: peptidoglycans of cell wall tightly bind to AFB1, proved effective in presence of bile and acidic conditions as seen in human gut and saline environments, L. ferementum is used as a probiotic and is not considered a pathogen but has recently been found in cases of cholecystitis

Source: Wall-Martínez HA, Pascari X, Bigordà A, Ramos AJ, Marín S, Sanchis V. The fate of Fusarium mycotoxins (deoxynivalenol and zearalenone) through wort fermenting by Saccharomyces yeasts (S. cerevisiae and S. pastorianus). Food Res Int. 2019 Dec;126:108587. doi: 10.1016/j.foodres.2019.108587. Epub 2019 Jul 29. PMID: 31732066.
Additional information: Contents of yeast cell wall bind to ZEN and 4.5-31.25% was adsorbed, but in wort 31-72% of ZEN was removed.

Source: Ragoubi C, Quintieri L, Greco D, Mehrez A, Maatouk I, D'Ascanio V, Landoulsi A, Avantaggiato G. Mycotoxin Removal by Lactobacillus spp. and Their Application in Animal Liquid Feed. Toxins (Basel). 2021 Mar 2;13(3):185. doi: 10.3390/toxins13030185. PMID: 33801544; PMCID: PMC8000088.
Additional information: First study to look at mycotoxin removal in animal liquid feed. Lots of removal mechanisms discussed, most effective in removing ZEA compared to OTA and others. Strain used was CIP 76.13T. Different mediums (PBS or MRS) showed different removal percentages.

Source: Wang Y, Zhang J, Wang Y, Wang K, Wei H, Shen L. Isolation and characterization of the Bacillus cereus BC7 strain, which is capable of zearalenone removal and intestinal flora modulation in mice. Toxicon. 2018 Dec 1;155:9-20. doi: 10.1016/j.toxicon.2018.09.005. Epub 2018 Sep 26. PMID: 30267721.

Source: Zhao, Hongfei & Wang, Xiao & Zhang, Junwen & Zhang, Jun & Bolin, Zhang. (2016). The mechanism of Lactobacillus strains for their ability to remove fumonisins B1 and B2. Food and chemical toxicology : an international journal published for the British Industrial Biological Research Association. 97. 10.1016/j.fct.2016.08.028.
Additional information: NA

Additional information: Adsorption phenomenon of OTA on conidia of black aspergilli could be related to hydrophobic interactions

Source: Zhu R, Feussner K, Wu T, Yan F, Karlovsky P, Zheng X. Detoxification of mycotoxin patulin by the yeast Rhodosporidium paludigenum. Food Chem. 2015 Jul 15;179:1-5. doi: 10.1016/j.foodchem.2015.01.066. Epub 2015 Jan 19. PMID: 25722132.

Characterization context: live culture (in vitro - mimic GIT conditions)
Source: Petruzzi L, Corbo MR, Sinigaglia M, Bevilacqua A. Ochratoxin A Removal by Yeasts after Exposure to Simulated Human Gastrointestinal Conditions. J Food Sci. 2016 Nov;81(11):M2756-M2760. doi: 10.1111/1750-3841.13518. Epub 2016 Oct 12. PMID: 27732755.
Additional information: there are known degradation methods that produce byproducts that are better at removing the toxin, yeast does not produce byproducts but tranist/OTA-binding mech is unclear

Characterization context: live culture (in vivo and in vitro)
Source: Wang L, Wu J, Liu Z, Shi Y, Liu J, Xu X, Hao S, Mu P, Deng F, Deng Y. Aflatoxin B1 Degradation and Detoxification by Escherichia coli CG1061 Isolated From Chicken Cecum. Front Pharmacol. 2019 Jan 17;9:1548. doi: 10.3389/fphar.2018.01548. PMID: 30705630; PMCID: PMC6344451.
Additional information: This strain of E coli is not pathogenic. Extracellular extracts had a much higher rate of degradation compared to intracellular extracts. Degradation rate varied based on heat exposure indicating that the protein responsible is heat-dependent, thus encouraging the prediction that there is an enzyme involved.

Source: Chen SW, Hsu JT, Chou YA, Wang HT. The application of digestive tract lactic acid bacteria with high esterase activity for zearalenone detoxification. J Sci Food Agric. 2018 Aug;98(10):3870-3879. doi: 10.1002/jsfa.8904. Epub 2018 Mar 1. PMID: 29364505.
Additional information: Observed differences in strains of Lactobacillius plantarums' use of carbon sources, no biotransformants were present and reduction in mycotoxin was by biodegredation. All strains did show binding of toxin to cell wall. Strain B2 had the highest ZEA degrading activity, decreasing ZEA by 52%. All strains showed binding of ZEA to cell wall and biodegredation by esterase

Characterization context: live culture with supernatent , liquid culture
Source: Guan S, Ji C, Zhou T, Li J, Ma Q, Niu T. Aflatoxin B1 Degradation by Stenotrophomonas Maltophilia and Other Microbes Selected Using Coumarin Medium. International Journal of Molecular Sciences. 2008; 9(8):1489-1503.
Additional information: Study looked at intracellular cell extracts and supernatent. Identification of enzyme is still necessary . Proteinase K, proteinase K plus SDS and heating significantly reduced or eradicated the degradation activity of the culture supernatant.
